name: V-019: Electrical Power Washers and Steam Cleaners

competencies.name: Operative checks that equipment is marked to confirm that it has been inspected recently and tested for electrical safety
Operative reports any unmarked equipment to supervisor and sets it aside
Operative checks that there are no obvious signs of damage or defects
Operative checks that the controls are present and in working order
Operative checks that cables are not damaged, worn or frayed
Operative checks that the lance and hoses are in good working condition
Operative checks that the socket is in good condition and has Residual Current Device Protection (RCD)
Operative tests the RCD trip switch and re-set prior to use
Operative checks that the plug is not cracked or damaged, and that all pins are securely in place
Operative checks that the plug is securely attached to the cable and that the outer casing of the cable is securely held in the cable grip
Operative checks power washing/steam cleaning will not damage the surface to be cleaned
Operative understands the COSHH (control of substances hazardous to health) assessment if chemical additives and applies this knowledge where appropriate
Operative is aware of and understands the precautions and emergency actions to be followed when chemical additives are to be used
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is a COSHH assessment?
  2. Where can you find out about precautions to be taken and emergency procedures when using chemicals?

competencies.name: Operative reports any defects or problems as specified in company procedure and sets equipment aside
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for reporting defects in or problems with equipment and materials to your supervisor?

competencies.name: Operative does not attempt to use any item of equipment that has a label declaring it to be defective or in need of servicing
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why should items of equipment labeled defective or in need of service not be used?

competencies.name: Operative always wears a waterproof suit, full face visor, safety wellingtons with protective toecaps and midsoles, and gloves when using the power washer or steam cleaner
Operator ensures hazard warning system is in place and area is cordoned
Operative always wears high visibility clothing when using the power washer or steam cleaner
Operative maintains a good grip of the lance and a firm footing before using the power washer or steam cleaner
Operative ensures the correct nozzle type, angle and distance from soil for effective use
Operative manages the cables to reduce the risk of tripping or falling
Operative does not use the power washer or steam cleaner when there is a risk of freezing temperatures
Operative uses a safe and designated working platform when working at height to perform tasks
competencies.supportingText: 1. Why is it necessary to use the platform when working at height?

competencies.name: Operative does not leave power washer or steam cleaner unattended when switched on and running
Operative does nothing to endanger the public while undertaking cleaning operations
competencies.supportingText:
1. What is the company procedure for ensuring that the public are not endangered when carrying out cleaning operations?
  2. What precautions must be taken to avoid endangering members of the public?

competencies.name: Operative avoids any conflict or argument with the general public and withdraws politely from a difficult situation and informs supervisor immediately
competencies.supportingText: 1. What is the company procedure for avoiding conflict or argument with the general public?
